title: The Syringe: Design That Saves Billions of Lives
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Syringe: Design That Saves Billions of Lives.

hook.text: The disposable syringe is one of the most manufactured objects on Earth â€” 16 billion per year.

buildup.text: Before disposables, glass syringes were reused and sterilized â€” spreading infections when protocols failed.

discovery.text: In 1956, Becton Dickinson designed a cheap, single-use plastic syringe. It eliminated reuse contamination.

twist.text: Auto-disable syringes that break after one use were invented because healthcare workers kept reusing disposables.

climax.text: Medical device design must account for human behavior, not just engineering. Design for misuse.

punchline.text: The best medical design assumes people will do the wrong thing.

quiz.question: Why were auto-disable syringes invented?
options: Because healthcare workers were reusing disposable syringes
